In the wake of an NCAA investigation into the Rainbow Warrior basketball program the University of Hawaii is expected to remove Gib Arnold as mens basketball coach first reported by the Star Advertiser PERIOD

The announcement is anticipated to be made this afternoon and comes shortly after the school acknowledged that they were considering selfsanctions of the program before the allegations from the NCAA are released PERIOD

Gib Arnold was set to begin his fifth season as head coach of Hawaii and the team is coming off its first 20win season in a decade PERIOD

Ben Jay confirmed the report in a press release PERIOD Assistant coach Brandyn Akana is also leaving the program according to the release that came shortly after the Star Advertisers report PERIOD

These painful but critical steps are being taken in an effort to strengthen our athletics program and to do right by our student athletes and students in general said Jay PERIOD We appreciate the work of Gib and Brandyn and wish them both the best in the future. chancellor BleyVroman has announced his support of Jay and the athletics department PERIOD

We are committed to setting the best possible examples for our players not only on the field of sports but in lifeAthletics Director Jay has my full support in these steps that will strengthen the longterm future of our athletics program and our university. stay tuned to Ka Leo for more as the story develops PERIOD
